review: Amazing. I have had Rokus in the past and still use them, but since we set up a den with no cable I didn't want to give up the plug in on my tv so I bought this. I ended up using it on the master bedroom television and it's my favorite. I typically watch more Prime so it just made sense to have the amazon stick in the bedroom. Really quick load up and super easy to use.
author: rae

review: It may be me, but I hate this thing. I have a Roku 3 at home and bought the Fire TV Stick for my vacation home. When I powered it up, I looked for "Channels." I couldn't find an option for those. Finally, by moving around in all the options, I found PBS. I got it, and then there were a few others recommended. My cable carrier at the beach place doesn't work with most of them, so I tried to find other free ones. I found one at a time, all with great difficulty. This is definitely not as easy as my Roku.You don't turn Roku off. I found in the Fire Stick's settings a "sleep" option, but to use it, it appears that you have to go to settings every time and check "sleep." Should it not be put to sleep? Okay, it's now 5 minutes later. I googled Fire TV stick and sleep and found that it puts itself to sleep after 30 minutes. I don't think I should have to look up every little question I have about this thing. My Roku's little instruction sheet included this vital piece of info, but amazon did not.I have pretty much washed my hands of this thing. I would really love to know what I am doing wrong or how to find out how to do things correctly. I would hate to have wasted money, even if it was only $19.
